title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 27.1 - Capital notes and debentures as capital stock
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 27.1 - Capital notes and debentures as capital stock

State Regulations

Every capital note or debenture issued by a bank or trust
company and authorized by the superintendent in accordance with section
96
(4)
of the Banking Law and Supervisory

Procedure CB 111, shall be in all respects considered and treated as a share of
capital stock having a par value equal to the face amount of such note or
debenture, for purposes of Banking Law, sections 97, 98(1)(a) and (1)(e), 103(1), 106, 121, 7001 and 7002. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3
ยง
27.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
